text: Live at Montmartre (also released as Stan's Party) is a live album by saxophonist Stan Getz which was recorded at the Jazzhus Montmartre in 1977 and released on the SteepleChase label.Stan Getz Catalog, accessed July 25, 2016 ==Reception== The AllMusic review by Ken Dryden said that "All of the musicians are in top form throughout... This is an excellent outing that belongs in every Stan Getz fan's collection." ==Track listing== ===Disc One=== # "Morning Star" (Rodgers Grant) – 12:51 # "Lady Sings the Blues" (Alec Wilder) – 7:59 # "Cançao do Sol" (Milton Nascimento) – 8:46 # "Lush Life" (Billy Strayhorn) – 4:43 # "Stan's Blues" (Stan Getz) – 8:06 # "La Fiesta" (Chick Corea) – 8:58 Bonus track on CD reissue ===Disc Two=== # "Infant Eyes" (Wayne Shorter) – 6:37 # "Lester Left Town" (Shorter) – 13:25 # "Eiderdown" (Steve Swallow) – 12:26 # "Blues for Dorte" (Getz) – 8:22 # "Con Alma" (Dizzy Gillespie) – 18:16 Bonus track on CD reissue == Personnel == *Stan Getz – tenor saxophone *Joanne Brackeen – piano, electric piano *Niels-Henning Orsted Pedersen – bass *Billy Hart – drums == References == Category:1977 live albums Category:Stan Getz live albums Category:SteepleChase Records live albums Category:Albums recorded at Jazzhus Montmartre
title: Live at Montmartre (Stan Getz album)
